overview:
Emmanuel is the co-founder and CEO of Terefic, a reference hosting website for the job-seekers.

Emmanuel came up with the idea of online job references when he tried unsuccessfully to get a performance bonus for an unpaid international intern at his company. After receiving a definite no, Emmanuel felt compelled to find something else to show gratitude to the intern for his good work. He offered to serve as a reference. However, he knew that the chances that a prospective employer would call from overseas to speak with him were very slim. The internet was the solution.

Emmanuel is also a fervent triathlete. He qualified and made it to the Ironman 70.3 world championship in 2010 and 2012. Emmanuel was part of Team USA’s triathlon team (M35-39) at the 2011 ITU world championship.

Emmanuel was born in Paris. He has been living in the United States for more than 10 years. He holds an MBA degree from the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.
